The 'Louisiana Tech Bulldogs football' program represents Louisiana Tech
University in college football at the NCAA Division I Football Bowl Subdivision
(formerly Division I-A) level. La Tech will begin competing as a member of
Conference USA in 2013. Since 2013, the Bulldogs have been coached by Skip
Holtz. Since 1968, the Bulldogs have played their home games at Joe Aillet
Stadium. Since the Bulldogs first season in 1901, Louisiana Tech has compiled an
all-time record of 571 wins, 430 losses, and 37 ties. In 110 football seasons,
the Bulldogs have won 3 Division II national championships, won 25 conference
championships, and played in 21 postseason games including 6 major bowl games.
La Tech has defeated at least one team from each of the current 11 FBS
conferences, and La Tech is the only team from a non-AQ conference to defeat an
SEC champion in the BCS era as the Bulldogs defeated Alabama in 1999.
